title: Effects of changes on nominal, real interest rates

content.description:
In answering the question, you should emphasize the line of reasoning that generated your results; it is not enough to list the results of your analysis. Include correctly labeled diagrams, if useful or required, in explaining your answers. A correctly labeled diagram must have all axes and curves clearly labeled and must show directional changes.

Interest rates are important in explaining economic activity.

Using a correctly labeled graph of the money market, show how an increase in the income level will affect the nominal interest rate in the short run.

Using a correctly labeled graph of the loanable funds market, show how a decision by households to increase saving for retirement will affect the real market interest rate in the short run.

Suppose that the nominal interest rate has been 6 percent with no expected inflation. If inflation is now expected to be 2 percent, determine the value of each of the following.

The new nominal interest rate

The new real interest rate
content.question: Respond to all parts of the question.
